<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Attachment 7-1
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage167"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="38%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 18:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company shall have nine Directors
<U>
	and three Supervisors
</U>
	, all to be elected from among shareholders with full legal capacity and with the election be
	done through the candidate nomination system in accordance with Article 192-1 of the Company Act. The term of Directors
<U>
	and Supervisors
</U>
	shall be three years, and all Directors
<U>
	and Supervisors
</U>
	are eligible for re-election. The total
	number of registered shares required to be held by all Directors and Supervisors shall be dealt with in accordance with the &#147;Regulations for Examination of the Percentage of Shares Held by Directors and Supervisors for Public Companies&#148;
	published by the Securities and Futures Commission, Ministry of Finance.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company may purchase liability insurance for the Directors and Supervisors
	during their term to cover their actions on behalf of the Company.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company shall have nine Directors,
<U>
	with at least three Independent Directors and not less than one-fifth of all Directors being
	Independent Directors
</U>
	, all to be elected by shareholders with full legal capacity and with the election be done through the candidate nomination system in accordance with Article 192-1 of the Company Act. The term of Directors shall be three
	years, and all Directors are eligible for re-election.
<U>
	The qualification and the relevant issues of Directors and Independent Directors shall comply with relevant laws and regulations
</U>
	. The total number of registered shares required to be held
	by all Directors shall be dealt with in accordance with the &#147;Regulations for Examination of the Percentage of Shares Held by Directors and Supervisors for Public Companies&#148; published by the Securities and Futures Commission, Ministry of
	Finance.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company may purchase liability insurance for the Directors during their
	term to cover their actions on behalf of the Company.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has elected Independent Directors in 2014 and has set up the Audit Committee to replace Supervisors. The amendments reflect such
	changes.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Merges Article 18-1.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 18-1:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Upon the end of the term of the Directors elected during the 2011 Shareholders&#146; Meeting, the Company shall have at least three (3)&nbsp;seats and not
	less than 20% of the total Directors as Independent Directors
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	The
	qualification and the relevant issues of Independent Directors shall comply with relevant laws and regulations.
</U>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Merged into Article 18.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 19:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where one-third of the Directors have been vacated
<U>
	or all of the Supervisors have been removed
</U>
	, a special shareholders&#146; meeting shall be convened
	and held by the Board of Directors within
<U>
	thirty
</U>
	days thereafter to elect new Directors
<U>
	or Supervisors
</U>
	to fill up the vacancies, but the term of newly elected Directors
<U>
	or Supervisors
</U>
	is limited to the residual term of the
	Directors
<U>
	or Supervisors
</U>
	who were vacated or removed.
<U>
	After the Company&#146;s public issuance of shares, a special shareholders&#146; meeting shall be convened and held by the Board of Directors within sixty (60) days to elect new
	Directors and Supervisors.
</U>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 19:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Where one-third of the Directors have been vacated
<U>
	or all of the Independent Directors have been discharged
</U>
	, a special shareholders&#146; meeting shall
	be convened and held by the Board of Directors within sixty days thereafter to elect new Directors or Independent Directors to fill up the vacancies, but the term of newly elected Directors
<U>
	or Independent Directors
</U>
	is limited to the residual
	term of the Directors
<U>
	or Independent Directors
</U>
	who were vacated or removed.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Deletion of Supervisors and addition of Independent Directors and related provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Deletion of superfluous
	text.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Attachment 7-2
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage168"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="38%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 20:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If new Directors
<U>
	or Supervisors
</U>
	cannot be elected in time before the current term of the incumbent Directors
<U>
	or Supervisors
</U>
	expires, it shall be
	dealt with in accordance with the applicable government regulations.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 20:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	If new Directors cannot be elected in time before the current term of the incumbent Directors expires, it shall be dealt with in accordance with the applicable
	government regulations.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Deletion of Supervisors and related provisions.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 21-1:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Irrespective of whether the Company makes profits or incurs losses, the Company may pay all its Directors
<U>
	and Supervisors
</U>
	a monthly transportation
	allowance. The amount of such allowance shall be determined by the Board of Directors in accordance with general criteria.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Responding to the Directors&#146;
<U>
	and Supervisors&#146;
</U>
	contributions to the Company and taking into considerations international and domestic industry
	practices, the Board of Directors shall be authorized to determine the remuneration for the Directors and Supervisors.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 21-1:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Irrespective of whether the Company makes profits or incurs losses, the Company may pay all its Directors a monthly transportation allowance. The amount of
	such allowance shall be determined by the Board of Directors in accordance with general criteria.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Responding to the Directors&#146; contributions to the Company and taking into considerations international and domestic industry practices, the Board of
	Directors shall be authorized to determine the remuneration for the Directors.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Deletion of Supervisors and related provisions.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 26:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Each Supervisor shall exercise his supervision power in accordance with applicable laws in and may attend the meetings of the Board of Directors to express
	his opinions, but shall not participate in the voting. The respective articles for Supervisors will be abandoned once the Supervisors elected in year of 2011 resigns, and replaced by
</U>
	the Audit Committee set up by the Board of Director pursuant
	to Article 14-4 of Securities and Exchange Act. Audit Committee will be comprised of all Independent Directors; the authorities and the relevant affairs will be established by Board of Directors pursuant to the relevant laws and regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Board of Directors can set up the remuneration committee and other functional committees. The qualifications of members, the authorities and the relevant
	affairs of such committee shall be established by the Board of Directors pursuant to the relevant laws and regulations.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 26:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Audit Committee set up by the Board of Director pursuant to Article 14-4 of Securities and Exchange Act. Audit Committee will be comprised of all
	Independent Directors; the authorities and the relevant affairs will be established by Board of Directors pursuant to the relevant laws and regulations.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Board of Directors can set up the remuneration committee and other functional committees. The qualifications of members, the authorities and the relevant
	affairs of such committee shall be established by the Board of Directors pursuant to the relevant laws and regulations.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Deletion of Supervisors and related provisions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Merged text.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Attachment 7-3
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage169"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="38%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 29:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At the end of each fiscal year, the following statements shall be prepared by the Board of Directors, and
<U>
	passed onto the Supervisors for auditing thirty
	(30) days
</U>
	prior to submission to the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting for approval.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. Business Report;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Financial Statements; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. Proposal for allocation of net earning or making up loss.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 29:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At the end of each fiscal year, the following statements shall be prepared by the Board of Directors, and
<U>
	delivered to the Audit Committee
</U>
	prior to
	submission to the General Shareholders&#146; Meeting for approval.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. Business
	Report;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Financial Statements; and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. Proposal for allocation of net earning or making up loss.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The Company has elected Independent Directors in 2014 and has set up an Audit Committee to replace Supervisors. The amendments reflect such changes.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 29-1:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	If the Company is profitable, it shall set aside 10% as employee compensation and 1% or less as Director compensation. However, if the Company has
	accumulated losses, it shall first deduct the accumulated losses, and then calculate the compensation from the remaining amount.
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	Employee compensation shall be in shares or cash, with recipients being the payroll employees of the Company or the domestic or foreign subsidiaries
	controlled 50% or more by the Company who worked substantially during the fiscal year in which the Company is profitable.
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	The issues relevant to distribution of employee compensation and Director compensation shall comply with relevant laws and regulations, and be set by
	resolutions of the Board of Directors.
</U>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Added in compliance with Article 235-1 of the Company Act, and with reference to Jing-Shang-Zi Letter No. 10402413890 from the Ministry of Economics, dated June&nbsp;11,
	2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Attachment 7-4
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage170"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="38%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="2%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="34%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="24%">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 30:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any earnings after the Company&#146;s fiscal year final settlement shall be allotted in the following order:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. Payment of taxes and dues.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Completing the deficit and losses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3. 10% for statutory surplus reserve.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<U>
	Remuneration to Directors and Supervisors shall no more than 1% of the remaining
	amount after allotting the amount required in Items 1 through 3
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5. Any further
	remaining amount
<U>
	will be for dividend to shareholders at 90% and bonus to employees at 10% as distributed or reserved. Employees eligible for bonus shall refer to such payroll employees (including payroll employees of the domestic or foreign
	subordinate companies controlled directly of 50% or more by the Company) who have substantially worked for the current FY in which bonus occurs
</U>
	.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 30:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Any earnings after the Company&#146;s fiscal year final settlement shall be allotted to each item in the following order:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1. Payment of taxes and dues.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2. Completing the deficit and losses.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<U>
	Set aside
</U>
	10% for statutory surplus reserve,
<U>
	unless the statutory surplus
	reserve has reached the total capital
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<U>
	Set aside or rotate special
	reserves
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5. Any further remaining amount
<U>
	shall be added to the unallocated
	surplus from the prior year as shareholder dividend and bonus. The Board of Directors shall draft a proposal to distribute the surplus, which shall be approved at a shareholders&#146; meeting
</U>
	.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Amended provisions related to employee bonus and Director remuneration in compliance with Article 235 of the Company Act and merged into
	Article 29-1.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Amended pursuant to accounting standards and in line with actual
	practice.
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 33:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	These Articles of Incorporation were enacted into on May&nbsp;4, 1984. The first amendment thereto was made on July&nbsp;20, 1984. The second amendment thereto
	was made on October&nbsp;11, 1986. The third amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;12, 1987. The fourth amendment was thereto made on May&nbsp;15, 1988. The fifth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;26, 1988. The sixth amendment was thereto
	made on July&nbsp;20, 1988. The seventh amendment was thereto made on August&nbsp;13, 1988. The eighth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;14, 1989. The ninth amendment was thereto made on March&nbsp;26,
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Article 33:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	These Articles of Incorporation were enacted into on May&nbsp;4, 1984. The first amendment thereto was made on July&nbsp;20, 1984. The second amendment thereto
	was made on October&nbsp;11, 1986. The third amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;12, 1987. The fourth amendment was thereto made on May&nbsp;15, 1988. The fifth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;26, 1988. The sixth amendment was thereto
	made on July&nbsp;20, 1988. The seventh amendment was thereto made on August&nbsp;13, 1988. The eighth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;14, 1989. The ninth amendment was thereto made on March&nbsp;26, 1990.
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Amend the record for the current
	amendment.

	1990. The tenth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;24, 1991. The eleventh amendment was thereto made on March&nbsp;20, 1992. The twelfth amendment was thereto made on March&nbsp;22, 1993. The thirteenth amendment was thereto
	made on May&nbsp;6, 1994. The fourteenth amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;26, 1995. The fifteenth amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;29, 1996. The sixteenth amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;22, 1997. The seventeenth amendment
	was thereto made on April&nbsp;15, 1998. The eighteenth amendment was thereto made on December&nbsp;29, 1999. The nineteenth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;15, 2000. The twentieth amendment was thereto made on October&nbsp;5, 2000. The
	twenty-first amendment was thereto made on May&nbsp;30, 2001. The twenty-second amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;3, 2002. The twenty-third amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;13, 2005. The twenty-fourth amendment was thereto made on
	June&nbsp;12, 2006. The twenty-fifth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;13, 2007. The twenty-sixth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;15, 2010. The twenty-seventh amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;22, 2011. The twenty-eighth
	amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;19, 2012. The twenty-ninth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;14, 2013.
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	The tenth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;24, 1991. The eleventh amendment was thereto made on March&nbsp;20, 1992. The twelfth amendment was thereto made on March&nbsp;22, 1993. The thirteenth amendment was thereto made on
	May&nbsp;6, 1994. The fourteenth amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;26, 1995. The fifteenth amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;29, 1996. The sixteenth amendment was thereto made on April&nbsp;22, 1997. The seventeenth amendment was
	thereto made on April&nbsp;15, 1998. The eighteenth amendment was thereto made on December&nbsp;29, 1999. The nineteenth amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;15, 2000. The twentieth amendment was thereto made on October&nbsp;5, 2000. The
	twenty-first amendment was thereto made on May&nbsp;30, 2001. The twenty-second amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;3, 2002. The twenty-third amendment was thereto made on June&nbsp;13, 2005. The twenty-fourth amendment was thereto made on

<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Attachment 8

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	Attachment 8-1
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage173"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	SUPPLEMENT AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Supplement Agreement (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Agreement
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) is to supplement the Share Subscription Agreement jointly executed by Siliconware
	Precision Industries Co., Ltd. (&#147;
<B>
<I>
	SPIL
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) and Tsinghua Unigroup Ltd. (&#147;
<B>
<I>
	Unigroup
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) on December&nbsp;11, 2015 (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Execution Date
</I>
</B>
	&#148;), with all other provisions remaining the same as
	in the underlying original agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7.1
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(1)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	As soon as possible and no later than
<U>
	June&nbsp;30, 2016
</U>
	, SPIL shall convene an extraordinary shareholders&#146; meeting and cause the approval of the amendment of its Articles of Incorporation in accordance with
	the contents of Attachment 7 and the approval of the subscription of the Private Placement Shares by the Subscriber.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.1
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(4)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	(a) if SPIL&#146;s board of directors fails to determine the pricing of the Private Placement Shares in accordance to Article 7.1(2) within ten days (unless an extension is otherwise agreed to by the Parties) after
	convening an extraordinary shareholders&#146; meeting to approve this private placement in accordance to Article 7.1; (b)&nbsp;if the Subscriber fails to obtain the Private Placement Shares within
<U>
	fifteen months
</U>
	after the Execution Date due
	to reasons not attributable to Unigroup or the Subscriber; or (c)&nbsp;if any of the conditions precedent in Article 5 cannot be fulfilled within
<U>
	fifteen months
</U>
	after the Execution Date, unless Unigroup agrees to extend the deadline, Unigroup
	may notify SPIL in writing to immediately terminate this Agreement
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(5)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	(a) if the Subscriber fails to obtain the Private Placement Shares within
<U>
	fifteen months
</U>
	after the Execution Date due to reasons not attributable to SPIL; or (b)&nbsp;if any of the conditions precedent in Article
	6 cannot be fulfilled within
<U>
	fifteen months
</U>
	after the Execution Date, unless SPIL agrees to extend the deadline, SPIL may notify Unigroup in writing to immediately terminate this Agreement
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	10.14
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<U>
	If the total number of shares being purchased does not exceed 300,000,000 shares, SPIL may implement treasury shares; if the number of shares exceeds 300,000,000 shares, SPIL shall seek Unigroup&#146;s consent. In
	addition, SPIL shall negotiate with Unigroup and seek Unigroup&#146;s prior consent on the handling of the treasury shares that are purchased.
</U>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="D167958DEX121_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_12>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_12"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
<A NAME="D167958DEX121_HTM_TX167958_34">
</A>
	Exhibit 12.1
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	CERTIFICATION OF OUR CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	I, Chi-Wen Tsai, certify that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	I have reviewed this annual report on Form 20-F of Siliconware Precision Industries Co., Ltd.;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such
	statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	3.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the
	company as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	4.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The company&#146;s other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control
	over financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for the company and have:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to ensure that material information relating to the company, including its
	consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

	financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

	period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

	materially affect, the company&#146;s internal control over financial reporting.

</TR>

	company&#146;s board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent functions):

<B>
	Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In connection with the Annual Report of Siliconware Precision Industries Co., Ltd. on Form 20-F for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 as
	filed with the SEC on the date hereof, I, Chi-Wen Tsai, the Chief Executive Officer of the Company, hereby certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.&#167; 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, to the best of my
	knowledge, that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	1.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section&nbsp;13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	2.
</TD>

	The information contained in the report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and results of operations of the company.
</TD>
</TR>

<B>
	Pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section&nbsp;1350
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	filed with the SEC on the date hereof, I, Eva Chen, the Chief Financial Officer of the Company, hereby certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C.&#167; 1350, as adopted pursuant to Section&nbsp;906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, to the best of my knowledge,
	that:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

	&nbsp;

	1.
